$description: This module acts like an electrical ground - it provides a SAFE PATH for errors to discharge without damaging the system.
$why_needed: Not every error should crash the system - some can be handled gracefully
Users need friendly messages, not stack traces
Failed tasks need somewhere to go that doesn't block everything else
$lean_equivalent: Scrap/rework area - defects go somewhere safe for handling
$electrical_analogy: A ground wire safely discharges excess current to earth, preventing shocks
name: Ground

uncaught_exception.safe_default: I encountered an issue and couldn't complete this. Mei has been notified.
uncaught_exception.$why: User gets a message, Mei knows there's a problem, system doesn't crash

timeout.message: Task timed out. Partial results returned.
timeout.$why: Better to return something than nothing - release resources for others

validation_failure.$why: Validation failures might be transient - try again before giving up

log_destination.$why: All errors go to a central log for analysis and debugging

retention_days.$why: Keep 30 days of errors for pattern analysis, then clean up

$how_to_read_this: 1. This is your 'what happens when things go wrong' playbook
2. Every error type has a defined handling strategy - no surprises
3. The pattern: log it, notify someone, give user a friendly message
4. Think of this as your safety net - errors land here, not on users
